{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3485988,"name":"Rishi Desai","username":"rdesai14","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/r/3ab097/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-01-17T20:47:09.103Z","cooked":"

Hey we had a question. Whenever our robot sees an April tag, it’s 0 heading changes. For example. If the robot sees an april tag that’s to its left then forward on the joystick becomes the direction towards the April tag. Does anyone know why?

Here is the Repo

github.com

GitHub - 7451AvengerRobotics/FRC2025

Contribute to 7451AvengerRobotics/FRC2025 development by creating an account on GitHub.

Which AprilTag were you using? I believe this would be caused by vision updating the odometry of the robot. If you were on say the red alliance and looking at tag 7, this would mean that straight would become toward the AprilTag. If this is correct, pat yourselves on the back, cause you guys got pose estimation for your bot working at some level!

Check both the drivetrain pose estimator pose and vision pose to see wether the issue is with updating the pose estimator or vision.

Because the “forward” of the robot is reset to align with the field

You can change your addVisionMeasurment function to ignore the rotation changes

I forgot exactly how to fix it, but I think you can create a new Pose3d, use the translate 3D from the vision measurement and the rotation3d from your robots current pose
